name: Westward Look Wyndham Grand Resort and Spa

reviews.text: As we sat sipping our ersatz resort coffee on our first day at the Westward Look Resort in Tucson Arizona AZ, because the expresso machine was broken, our aching backs kept us leaning on the table trying to stretch out our backs a bit. Our waiter Brett waiter had no idea when it might be fixed.
reviews.title: Bedder not sleep here

reviews.text: It was the first day of our 7 day stay from 2.15.08 thru 2.22.08 at the Westward Look Resort (www.westwardlook.com ), doyenne of resorts in the Tucson area. We are a family of five, joining three more family members for a mini family reunion at Westward Look.
reviews.title: In Rennovation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The grounds are impressive and well-kept with all variety of cactus, euphorbia, citrus trees and palms. A resident owl hooted hello to the twilight every evening near building 9, where we stayed.
reviews.title: Lovely Midweek Stay

reviews.text: Back to our backs and the aches: the beds are old and so soft that it was like sleeping in an upholstered salad bowl, causing us to wake up with our middle-aged backs in agony. The front desk readily acknowledged that the beds were too soft for “some tastes” but that there was no solution until the rooms were renovated. We repeatedly requested to speak to a manager, but the manager Alan Klein was never available, even when asked for by name. Much insistence finally brought the engineering department around to putting boards between the box spring and the mattress, but we ended up sleeping on the floor on cot mattresses as the beds were still too soft and worn out in the center. This is really a scandal for a resort charging $391 per night. Please do not believe the standard corporate reply that Westward Look will post in reply to this decidedly mixed review which blames everything on the on-going renovation: while some small part of the resort is being renovated, none of our complaints were related to renovation issue, as beds can be replaced anytime. The beds are so bad that the staff had many excuses ready.
reviews.title: Great stay...a little off-putting at first...
Not worth the high rate
reviews.text: Our room had an aging bathroom with mildew and shower flow issues, and the whole bath area just had paint slathered all over it with no effort to smooth out the walls after repairs.

The grounds of this hotel were very well maintained and very beautiful. There are several walking trails around the hotel that are very nice. The hotel offers horseback riding, and has a full service spa. The entire staff was probably the friendliest I have encountered at any hotel. They went out of their way to make you feel at home.
reviews.title: Not too bad....

likes.disliked: — Dirty sofa and blow dryer in room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was OK. The bed was very comfortable, but the armoire that housed the TV was off to one side of the room, so it was difficult to watch unless you laid all the way to one side. The sofa set showed wear and was dirty, but the rest of the furniture was good. Bring your own blow dryer as the one provided in the hotel barely did the job (especially if you have long hair). The resort is planning on updating all the rooms as they had displays of the new decor in the lobby. Overall, the room was very clean and cozy.
reviews.title: Poor Quality, Poor Service, But with a smile

likes.liked: — price, but in end was not value

reviews.text: I also appreciated that all areas at night were well-lit, especially around the room entrance.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.text: The pool area was nice with padded lounge chairs and beverage service! The outside patio from the lobby has a breakfast cart in the morning/afternoon that serves pastries, fruit and Starbucks coffee (not just regular coffee, but most everything you can normally get from Starbucks).
reviews.title: Wonderful experience

likes.liked: — size of room; efficient and friendly staff; beautiful grounds and mountain views; food
likes.disliked: — beds and a dank bar and grille

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Parking was a bit scarce but I always found a place. We were also part of a convention that was held at the hotel, which most likey explains the parking situation. Please note that there is parking by the rooms, but the main parking lot for the resort is a bit odd as it seems to be built on a sloping hill divided into several sections, so be prepared to walk up hill when heading to the resort.
reviews.title: Westward Look Resort Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Over a 9-day stay, the place was flawless. Room comfortable and quiet, staff polite, efficient, helpful when given the opportunity; grounds attractive, food good, prices acceptable for a resort. 3 swimming pools. Many attractions in the area, all reached by long drives through unattractive urban sprawl.
reviews.title: Great experience

likes.liked: — high qualty execution of all details

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having just returned from this resort I must agree that the rooms are in need of attention. Our hot water handle didn't work one one sink, but there was two -there was more than a little "crud" around the tub and the drain was clogged- But when we told the staff it was backing up "hair that was not ours" they took care of it immediately. The staff was attentive and pleasant and because the grounds area is so nice we saw no reason to hang out in the room. I wasn't real happy with the super soft bed, but I was thrilled to find extra blankets and pillows - no shortage of toiletries either. I think the resort may be past its prime but it is in a nice area, with good amenities and is priced accordingly. They offer pre-printed out directions to area attractions. Besides 2 guests pools, they have a lap pool and fitness center by the tennis courts. The grounds are clean and most paths lit after dark. It is a very nice atmosphere to walk around in and view birds, snakes, rabbits, and various flora.
reviews.title: The grounds make the difference

reviews.text: I use trip advisor for all of our trips...and it has not failed me yet. After reviewing the reviews..throwing out the extreme good and bad..I decided on Westward Look Resort and 7 visits later, I have never been disappointed!!! We have also stayed at the Westin, which is double the cost. I would take the Westward Look hands down over the Westin, even if it was the same price!!!
reviews.title: Choose this over the Westin, hands down!

reviews.text: The rooms...the size is amazing. So roomy and allows several women to get ready at once! You should stay at the Westin and then decide if these rooms and beds are really as bad as you say.
reviews.title: Rooms need updating!

reviews.text: The Restaurants...normally we don't like resort restaurants, way too pricey. This is the first resort where we can't wait to dine at the restaurant. The variety on the menu is so nice to see, but wait until you see the presentation and the platters that are used. The food tastes so good and is so enjoyable on the patio overlooking the foothills.
reviews.title: Great views, terrible rooms, beds, pool. Unsafe

reviews.text: We really enjoyed our 3 nite stay here, largely based on the reviews I had read from other TripAdvisor users. Our room was lovely, we had a nice view of the mountains & one of the pools; the only negative was that we were on the lower level & could sometimes hear the floor creak when the people above us walked around their room. Loved the pillow top mattress on our King bed & the quality linens. And, the resort gives you very generous sizes of skin & hair products - & they are of excellent quality too.
reviews.title: Really, really nice stay; 2 thumbs up
Loved the ambience of this charming resort….
reviews.text: Although it has quite a few rooms, it doesn't give the impression of being large because there are at least 3 pools in different locations and a couple of spas spread around. We found the food in the Gold Room to be of excellent quality. The grounds, trails & the wildlife were fantastic. We would most definitely return to this hotel and would recommend it highly.

We stayed for 5 nights. We enjoyed the favor of the southwest it gave us, mountain views, walking trails and adobe style buildings. The plants around the resort were remarkable beautiful flowering cactus, saguaros, palm trees.
reviews.title: Westward Look is a Keeper

likes.liked: — the beautiful desert setting and southwestern ambiance

reviews.title: Hotel has management problems
reviews.text: They seem to hold small conventions/business meetings; there were some business people around. Everyone seemed happy to be there.

Our room was 104, which was very close to the main pool; it was a quiet room facing the trail and mountain. The room was clean and spacious the bed was extremely comfy. The small refrigerator was an added benefit. The room is in need of updating but as stated in previous reviews they are in the process of renovating the rooms.
reviews.title: It's the Real Deal, Dudes and Dudettes
